functions.description: Get the length of a string.
functions.name: length

returns.description: Length of the string

functions.description: Get the length of an array.
functions.name: length

returns.description: Length of the array

functions.description: Get the i-th character of a string.
functions.name: get

params.name: i
params.description: Zero-based index of a character in the string

returns.description: The i-th character of the string

functions.description: Get the i-th item of an array.
functions.name: get

params.name: i
params.description: Zero-based index of the item to get

returns.description: The i-th element in the array

functions.description:
Get the item after the first item in the array that is equal to the given key.
E.g., `[ :a 1 :b 2 ] :a 0 get` would return the value after `:a`, which is `1`.
functions.name: get

returns.description: The value at the given key or nil if the key is not found

functions.description: Set the i-th character of a string.
functions.name: set

params.name: i
params.description: Zero-based index of a character in the string

returns.description: The updated stringPolar

functions.description: Set the i-th item of an array.
functions.name: set

params.name: i
params.description: Zero-based index of the item to set

returns.description: The updated array

functions.description: Set the item after the first item in the array that is equal to the given key. If the key is not found, it is appended to the array.
functions.name: set

returns.description: The updated array

functions.description:
Get the item after the first item in the array that is equal to the given key.
E.g., `[ :a 1 :b 2 ] :a 0 key-get` would return the value after `:a`, which is `1`.
functions.name: key-get

params.name: default
params.description: Default value that is returned when the key is not found in the array

returns.description: The value at the given key or the default value if the key is not found

functions.description: Set the item after the first item in the array that is equal to the given key. If the key is not found, it is appended to the array.
functions.name: key-set

params.name: value
params.description: Value to assign at the given key

returns.description: The modified array

functions.description: Update the value of a key in the array by executing an executable array.
functions.name: key-update

params.name: default
params.description: Default value that is used when the key is not found in the array

params.name: updater
params.description: Executable array that is called with the value of the key (or the default value) on top of the stack and must push the updated value on the stack

returns.description: The modified array

functions.description: Update the value of a nested array. The keys are the indices of the value.
functions.name: path-set

params.name: keys
params.description: Keys to the position of the value to update

params.name: value
params.description: Value to assign at the given index

returns.description: The modified array

functions.description: Set the value of a key in a nested array. The keys are the keys of the value.
functions.name: path-key-set

params.name: keys
params.description: Path of keys to the value to change

params.name: value
params.description: Value to assign at the given key

returns.description: The modified array

functions.description: Update the value of a key in a nested array by executing an executable array. The keys are the keys of the value.
functions.name: path-update

params.name: keys
params.description: Path of keys to the value to update

params.name: default
params.description: Default value that is used when the key is not found in the array

params.name: updater
params.description: Executable array that is called with the value of the key (or the default value) on top of the stack and must push the updated value on the stack

returns.description: The modified array

functions.description:
Shuffle the given array.
Internally, this function uses rand-int, so it is deterministic when the seed is known.
functions.name: shuffle

returns.description: The shuffled array

returns.description: A new array with the items in reverse order

returns.description: The reversed string

returns.description: Modified array

params.name: index

returns.description: Array with the given index removed

functions.description: Remove the character at the given zero-based index from the string.

returns.description: Zero-based index of the object in the array or nil if not found

params.name: value
params.description: Value to search for, will be converted to :Str automatically

returns.description: Zero-based index of the substring in the string or nil if not found

functions.name: find-from

params.name: startAt
params.description: Zero-based start index of the search

returns.description: Zero-based index of the object in the array or nil if not found

functions.description: Find the index of the first occurence of a substring in a string.
functions.name: find-from

params.name: value
params.description: Value to search for, will be converted to :Str automatically

params.name: startAt
params.description: Zero-based start index of the search

returns.description: Zero-based index of the substring in the string or nil if not found

functions.description: Check if an array contains the given value.
functions.name: contains

returns.description: True if the array contains the given value, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if a string contains the given value.

example: "this is a test" "a" contains # returns true

functions.name: contains

params.name: value
params.description: Value, will be converted to :Str automatically

returns.description: True if the string contains the given value

functions.description:
Get a portion of an array, including all items from start (inclusive) to
end (exclusive). If no end is specified, all items from start will be included.
functions.name: slice

params.name: start
params.description: Zero-based index of the first item to include

params.name: end
params.description: Zero-based index of the first item that should not be included (optional)

returns.description: A new array containing the items in the given range

functions.description:
Get a portion of a string, including all characters from start (inclusive) to
end (exclusive). If no end is specified, all characters from start will be included.
functions.name: slice

params.name: start
params.description: Zero-based index of the first character to include

params.name: end
params.description: Zero-based index of the first character that should not be included (optional)

returns.description: The extracted substring

functions.description: Insert an item into an array.

params.description: Zero-based index at which to insert the item

returns.description: Array with the item inserted

functions.description: Insert a character into a string.
functions.name: insert

params.name: index
params.description: Zero-based index at which to insert the character

returns.description: String with the character inserted

functions.description: Insert a character into a string.
functions.name: insert

params.name: index
params.description: Zero-based index at which to insert the string

returns.description: String with the other string inserted

functions.description: Create a new array with the given length and initialize it.
functions.name: array

params.name: initializer
params.description: Executable array that will be executed for every array entry, the zero-based index is put on top of the stack and the value that the executable array pushes onto the stack is put into the array

returns.description: Array with the given length and values produced by the initializer

functions.description: Create a new array with the given length and set all items to the given value.
functions.name: array

params.name: value
params.description: Value to set all array items to

returns.description: Array with the given length and values

functions.description: Sort an array.
functions.name: sort

returns.description: Sorted array

functions.description: Check if a is smaller than b.

returns.description: true if a is smaller than b, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if the string a appears before b when sorted alphabetically.

returns.description: true if a comes before b in alphabetical order, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if a is smaller than or equal to b.

returns.description: true if a is smaller than or equal to b, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if the string a equals string b or appears before b when sorted alphabetically.

returns.description: true if a equals b or comes before b in alphabetical order, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if a is greater than b.

returns.description: true if a is greater than b, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if the string a appears after b when sorted alphabetically.

returns.description: true if a comes after b in alphabetical order, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if a is greater than or equal to b.

returns.description: true if a is greater than or equal to b, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if the string a equals string b or appears after b when sorted alphabetically.

returns.description: true if a equals b or comes after b in alphabetical order, false otherwise

functions.description:
Check if two objects are equal, according to the following rules:

* Numbers, booleans and strings are equal if they have the same value
* Symbols are equal if they have the same name
* Arrays are equal if all entries are equal

returns.description: true if the objects are equal, false otherwise

functions.description:
Check if two objects are not equal, according to the following rules:

* Numbers, booleans and strings are equal if they have the same value
* Symbols are equal if they have the same name
* Arrays are equal if all entries are equal

returns.description: true if the objects are not equal, false otherwise

functions.description:
Check if two objects are approximately equal, according to the following rules:

* Numbers are approximately equal if the difference is smaller than or equal to the tolerance
* Arrays are approximately equal if all entries are approximately equal
* For all other types, the tolerance is ignored and the `=` operator is used

returns.description: true if the objects are approximately equal, false otherwise

functions.description:
Check if two objects are not approximately equal, according to the following rules:

* Numbers are approximately equal if the difference is smaller than or equal to the tolerance
* Arrays are approximately equal if all entries are approximately equal
* For all other types, the tolerance is ignored and the `=` operator is used

returns.description: true if the objects are not approximately equal, false otherwise

functions.description: Run `then` if the `condition` is true or `else` otherwise.
functions.name: if

params.name: then
params.description: Code to run if the condition is true

params.name: else
params.description: Code to run if the condition is false (optional)

functions.description: Execute the first condition that returns `true`. Only the executable array of the first matching condition is executed.
functions.name: cond

params.name: conditions
params.description: Array of executable arrays, always pairs of an executable array that calculates a condition and an executable array that is executed if the condition is true

functions.description: Create a function that wraps `cond`.
functions.name: cond-fun

params.name: conditions
params.description: Array of executable arrays, always pairs of an executable array that calculates a condition and an executable array that is executed if the condition is true

functions.description: Execute the given executable array until the loop is exited with `break` or `breakif`.
functions.name: loop

params.name: body
params.description: Executable array to run in a loop

functions.description:
Execute the given executable array for every even number between lower (inclusive) and upper (exclusive).
Before every iteration, the current value is pushed on the stack.

example: 1 10 { println } for # prints the numbers from 1 to 9

functions.name: for

params.name: body
params.description: Executable array to run for number in the range

functions.description:
Execute the given executable array for every item of the array.
Before every iteration, the current item is pushed on the stack.
functions.name: for

params.name: body
params.description: Executable array to run for every item

functions.description:
Execute the given executable array for character of the string.
Before every iteration, the current character is pushed on the stack.

example: "hello" { println } for # prints h, e, l, l, o (one letter per line)

functions.name: for

params.name: body
params.description: Executable array to run for every character

functions.description:
Execute the given executable array for every item of the array.
Before every iteration, the current item and index are pushed on the stack.
functions.name: fori

params.name: body
params.description: Executable array to run for every item

functions.description:
Execute the given executable array for character of the string.
Before every iteration, the current character and index are pushed on the stack.
functions.name: fori

params.name: body
params.description: Executable array to run for every character

functions.description: Break the current loop.
functions.name: break

functions.description: Break the current loop if the condition is true.
functions.name: breakif

functions.description: Raise an error. This stops the program immediately.
functions.name: err

functions.description: Leave the current lambda function and call a function from the dictionary.
functions.name: tailcall

params.name: fn
params.description: Name of the function to call, must be in the dictionary

functions.description: Execute an object.

example: { #< more code here ># } exec # executes the executable array

functions.name: exec

functions.description: Create a function and save it into the current dictionary.
functions.name: fun

functions.description: Create a lambda function. This is like `fun` but puts the function on the stack and not in the dictionary.
functions.name: lam

returns.description: Lambda function

functions.description: Take a snapshot of the current dictionary and set copies of it as dictionary of the given functions.

example:
2 x!
x-squared: {
  x x *
} fun
x-squared # returns 4
5 x!
x-squared # still returns 4
[:x-squared] update-lam
x-squared # returns 25

functions.name: update-lam

params.name: functions
params.description: Array of symbols of the functions to update

functions.description: Pop values from the stack and bind them to the parameter list, that is, put them into the current dictionary with the names from the parameter list. An error is thrown if types don't match.

example:
42
"a string"
(a :Int, s :Str) popv
a # 42
s # "a string"

functions.name: popv

params.name: params
params.description: Parameter list to bind the stack content to

functions.description: Get the value of the given symbol from the current dictionary and put it on the stack, without executing it.

example:
demo: { "test" println } fun
:demo vref # get a reference to demo, but don't execute it
exec # execute the reference (prints "test")

functions.name: vref

returns.description: Value of the dictionary entry

functions.description: Check if an object is an empty array or executable array or nil.
functions.name: empty?

returns.description: True if the object is an empty array or executable array or nil, false otherwise

functions.description: Put a value in the dictionary under the specified name.

example:
42 x!
x # put the value of x (42) on the stack

functions.description: Define a new data type. This will generate a constructor, a type check function and accessors and put them into the dictionary.
functions.name: datadef

functions.description: Define a union data type that can be one of the given data types. This puts a union type check function into the dictionary.
functions.name: datadef

params.name: variants
params.description: Data types the union should contain

functions.description: Check if a and b are true.
functions.name: and

returns.description: True if a and b are true, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if all values in the array are :Bool and true. All items are executed, so executable arrays that produce a :Bool may be used. The evaluation is stopped when the first non-true value is encountered.
functions.name: and

returns.description: True if all items are true, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if a or b is true, or both are true.
functions.name: or

returns.description: True if a or b are true, false otherwise

functions.description: Check if at least one values in the array is :Bool and true. All items are executed, so executable arrays that produce a :Bool may be used. The evaluation is stopped when the first true value is encountered.

example:
[
  false
  {1 2 <}
  {#< this is never executed >#}] or # returns true

functions.name: or

returns.description: True if at least one item is true, false otherwise

functions.description: Negate a boolean value.
functions.name: not

returns.description: True if the boolean is false, false otherwise

functions.description:
Initialize the random number generator with the given seed. When initialized
with the same seed, the generated random numbers will be deterministic.

example:
1 rand-seed # seed the random number generator
10 rand-int # 2
10 rand-int # 4

functions.name: rand-seed

params.name: seed
params.description: Any number to be used as seed
